loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 43-year-old, married man from Bohol, Philippines. He is the father of seven children. He has been engaged in a vegetable farming business for more than 17 years. This is the source of his income.

Felix is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and nylon for trellises. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his farm and his harvest. Furthermore, he can sell more vegetables to the market, augmenting his income and profit. In the future, he hopes to make his farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and nylon for trellises

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 29 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 2 years. He is a livestock trader in Koibatek. He has been in this business for a period of four years, earning an income of KES 15,000.

He has borrowed his second loan from KADET LTD, in the amount of KES 50,000. He intends to purchase more livestock, and later he will resell them. The profits he earns will be used to obtain more livestock, and to add to his grazing land. He hopes to educate his children and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: To purchase livestock, for later resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is single. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past three years, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are town dwellers and her neighbours. She dreams of expanding her business, to meet her basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to buy shampoo, hair braids, earrings, body lotions, and other salon supplies. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair braids, earrings, body lotions, and other salon supplies

loans.name: Omar Eliceo

texts.es: Don Omar de 32 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 6 años es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar. Vive con a su esposa y sus dos hijas,  es muy trabajador,  siembra todos los años  maíz y maicillo. omar desea incrementar sus ventas y por solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía que es donde siembra. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Omar, 32 years old, has made his living in agriculture for 6 years.  He is a man who is very responsible with his household expenses.  He lives with his wife and his two daughters.  He is very hardworking.

Every year he plants corn and sorghum.  Omar wishes to increase his sales, which is why is is applying for a loan that will allow him to buy:  seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, among other things, and to improve the land where he plants, which is shown in the photograph.

He would like to count on the support he has requested since he doesn't have other income.  This way he will continue to bring home the daily bread without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides and to improve the land.

loans.name: Maria Elizabet

texts.es:
María de 38 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora, casada que de su matrimonio tiene 5 de los cuales los 2 mayores están en secundaria y los otros 3 en la escuela los cuales al salir de sus estudios ayudan a sus padres con las actividades en el hogar y en el campo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado y por falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres no pudo continuar ya que ellos eran de escasos recursos. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café hace 6 años en compañía de su esposo pero fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron la actividad desde muy pequeña. El terreno que ellos trabajan es propio gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo que juntos pusieron para adquirirlo el cual está ubicado a una distancia de un kilómetro de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos. 

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para sus cultivos de café ya que estos productos son caros y son necesarios para que sus cultivos estén sanos y libres de roya enfermedad que destruye cultivos completos de café y plagas.

Su meta es mantener su cultivo sano y libre de plagas y otros que lo puedan dañar para poder tener una buena cosecha y así mismo obtener buenas y mejores ganancias para re invertir en sus cultivos ya que este es su único ingreso para el sustento de su familia y el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  She is married and has five children, two of whom attend secondary school and the other three also attend school.  They help their parents after school in the home and in the fields.  She has a third grade education and was not able to continue because her parents were of limited resources.  She raises coffee and has been doing so, along with her husband, for six years.  It was her parents who taught her when she was very young.  The land they work belongs to them, thanks to the work and effort they put in together to acquire it and it’s located one km from her home.  They walk there each day to maintain their crops.

She is asking for help to buy fertilizer and compost for her coffee crops.  They are expensive and she needs them so that her crops will be healthy and free from disease that destroys crops completely.

Her goal is to keep her crops healthy and free from disease and other things that can damage them, so that she will have a good harvest and be able to obtain better earnings.  This is her only form of support for her family and her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Elmer Adalberto

texts.es: Elmer vive en con su tía y primo en casa de la tía, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 6 años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol también trabaja como jornalero en una finca cerca de su casa,  con las ventas que realiza de sus productos logra obtener una buena ganancia que le sirve para ayudar en los gastos de la casa, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para comprar  lo necesario para la agricultura por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar abono, semillas, fertilizantes, herramientas, etc. para obtener una mejor cosecha y así poder obtener una mejor ganancia para seguir ayudando en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Elmer lives with his aunt and cousin in his aunt's home. He has been in the agriculture business for six years, and his primary crops are corn and beans. He also works as a day laborer at a farm near his home.  With his sales of his products he manages to earn a good income that he uses to help with the household expenses.  However, his income does not stretch far enough to purchase the necessities of farming.  

For that reason, he is requesting this loan which will allow him to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, tools, etc. With these, he can get a bigger harvest and thus greater income to continue to help with his home expenses.

loans.use: purchase manure, seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo grows rice crops on his 3.5 hectares of farmland in the local community. He has been in this business for almost 23 years. He is now 40 years old, married and blessed with two children.

Reynaldo is thankful that he was able to improve his business through wise management, dedication and adaptation to new farming strategies. His desire to have a prosperous business made him borrow 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP)  which will be used to buy 4 bags of seedlings, 11 bags of fertilizer and 8 bottles of insecticides. He knows that through this loan he will be able to increase his income and have a good harvest. His profit will enable him to meet the needs of his family and improve their way of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong was born in 1976. She has two children who are learning at primary school and high school. Her husband is a driver. Hong is a tailor. She has done this job for four years. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND.  Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Hong has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2005. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy gas to start her business of selling gas. She always wants to raise her children up well and have more money for business.

loans.use: to buy gas to start her business of selling gas.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 30 years old and blessed with four children. He is a livestock trader in the Bomet area and has been running his business for the past six years, making a monthly income of KES 20,000. Bernard learned about KADET LTD from fellow traders in Bomet market. He has borrowed his first loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase more cattle for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His future dreams is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le was born in 1970. She has two sons, who are learning at school. Her husband and she are fish sellers. His income is about 7,000,000 VND per month. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 10 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.

Le has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2005. In the previous loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND. She will use the loan to buy more crabs and fish to sell in her seafood store. She always wants to have more money, to enlarge her business and to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy more crabs and fish to sell in her seafood store.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik lives in Vardavank village in the region of Syunik. She has been engaged in farming and agriculture for over 20 years. The only person that helps Shoghik is her husband. 

They have a big private plot of land and they cultivate a variety of fruit and vegetables. On their farm, they keep cattle and chickens. They put great effort into cultivating their agricultural products, which they sell in the nearby towns of Kapan and Kajaran. Shoghik has many relatives and friends in these towns who help her in realization of her products. 

Shoghik needs a  loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to organise the work of hay gathering and to buy 3 calves. She hopes very much that Kiva lenders will help and support her.

loans.use: To organise the work of hay gathering and to buy 3 calves

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a man of fifty years who is married to Irene and a father of two. He supplies meat in Kangemi and has been doing so for seven years. He gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. This will be Antony's third loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase meat for resale. In future he wants to educate his children and also to be a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: To buy meat for resale

loans.name: Blama Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Blama” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 500,000 leones each in order to invest in their respective businesses.

Fatmata is the featured leader of this group. Fatmata is 34 years old and married with one child who is attending primary school. Fatmata sells fish and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying a large quantity of fish.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 32 year old gentleman who resides in Bomet town. He is married to Jane, who operates a greengrocer, and is a father of two children. He learned about KADET LTD from a shopkeeper who is a registered member, and had already been funded by KADET LTD. Paul supplies water to different premises and households as a way of earning some income; he has been in the water business for the last four years. He has borrowed his second loan of KES 40,000, which will assist him in buying a cart and a donkey for ease of transportation. The proceeds will be used to meet the family's basic needs. Paul hopes to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a donkey and a cart

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi runs a retail business in Nakuru town, where she sells a variety of items, such as caps, mirrors, and electrical goods, among others. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD after paying off her previous loan on time.

She plans to buy a bale of jackets and to add to her stock of caps, sweaters, belts and electrical appliances to sell in her business. With the anticipated profits, she plans to open up a wholesale shop.  

In the near future, she hopes to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a bale of jackets and to add to her stock of other items in her business.

loans.name: Glady

texts.en:
Glady is a married mother with school-going kids, who are the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. She has operated a cereals shop business at the market for the past several years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality and delayed payments by debtors as her major challenges in the business.

With this Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, and sugar. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in society.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung was born in 1960. She has four children who have their own families. Her husband is a guard. His income is about 3,000,000 VND. Hung raises pigs, grows rice and performs labour to earn a living. She earns 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for many years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

Hung has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy food for her pigs. Her dream is to buy some more furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 45 years old, married, and has eight children, five of whom are in school. She has a farming business in Nakuru. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizer and pay for farm labour. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profit from the loan, she hopes to educate her children and boost her business. She also hopes to build rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and pay for farm labour.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. 

Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. Recently his taxi has not been working properly, so he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair the taxi as soon as possible, but due to lack of funds, he has found it difficult to cover the repair costs. Therefore Nargis has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the repair costs. This will help him to continue his business. Nargis is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Don Juan de 62 años  de edad, es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 22 años de edad,  El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista sale a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Don Juan solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan is 62 years old, very friendly and hard-working, and lives with his wife and 22-year-old son. He works very hard on his own land where he sows corn and beans. His crops are of very good quality. When his harvest is ready, he goes to sell it in the different markets that are close to where he lives. 

Juan is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to have the necessary funds to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies like pest control and fertilizers, compost, and seeds, among other things that he needs for his sowing. He wants to increase his sales in order to have greater profits and give his family a better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pest control and fertilizers, compost, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Erimina

texts.en:
Erimina is married and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For the past two years, she has operated a food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase construction materials for roofing her house and to buy more stock for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for roofing her house and to buy more stock for the business

loans.name: Mongonbagana

texts.en:
Mr. Mongonbagana is 43 years of age and lives with his wife and 4 children in Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Nyamduuren, works at a local kindergarten. His older son studies at university, and the 3 younger children study at a local secondary school. 

Mr.Mongonbagana works together with his siblings in furniture manufacturing, and he is now starting his own furniture manufacturing business. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory and equipment for his new wooden furniture manufacturing business. He is a hardworking, welcoming and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and equipment for his new wooden furniture manufacturing business

loans.name: Lilliana Patricia

texts.es:
Liliana,casada, madre de tres hijas de 13 y gemelas de 2 años de edad, de oficio comerciante , es dueña de una pulpería . Ella  esta agradecida por haber sido beneficiada con su primer credito Kiva, el cual utilizo para comprar granos , productos lacteos y de limpieza, logro surtir su pulperia y ofrecer variedad a su clientela.

Hoy esta  requiriendo este financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, perfumes, cosméticos, maquillaje, adornos. Pues se acerca el día de las madres y la mayoría de sus clientes buscan obsequios para regalar, desea estar preparada para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Además que es una oportunidad para mejorar los ingresos de sus negocios. Otro negocio que desea poner a futuro es la venta de electrodomésticos para diversificar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Liliana is married and the mother of 3 daughters, one who is 13 years old, and twins who are 2 years old. She is a saleswoman and an owner of a local convenience store. She is thankful for having benefited from her first Kiva loan, which she used to purchase grains, milk products, cleaning products, and she stocked her store and offered variety to her customers. 

Today she requires financing to purchase basic grains, perfumes, cosmetics, makeup, and decorations. Mother's day is nearing and the majority of her customers are looking for presents to give, so she wants to be prepared to attend to the demand of her customers. Furthermore, it is an opportunity to improve the incomes of her businesses. The other business that she wants to have in the future is the sale of electric appliances in order to diversify her income and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, perfumes, cosmetics, makeup, and decorations.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1974. She has two children, one who is a worker and one who is studying at university. Her husband sells food in the market to earn a living. Phuong helps her husband to do his job, and also raises pigs for earnings. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for three years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Phuong has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She always wants to have more money to improve her business and help her children get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam was born in 1970. He has two children, one who is a worker and one who is studying at secondary school. His wife is a worker. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Lam is a carpenter. His income is about 4,000,000 VND. He has done this job for a long time. His family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Lam has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2004. In the last cycle he borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, he would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy wood for his carpentry workshop. He always wants to have more money to enlarge his workshop and raise his children well.

loans.use: to buy wood for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is 41 years old, and he lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of three children. He is a rickshaw driver by profession. His rickshaw has not been working properly for the past many days. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it, as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Rashid has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Rashid is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en:
Nhi was born in 1976. She has three children who are learning at primary school and university. Her husband is a driver. Nhi raises pigs and grows landscape trees to earn a living. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for three years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She always wants to have more money to improve her business and help her children get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong was born in 1965. She has three children. Two of them have their own families. The youngest child is learning at high school. Her husband grows landscape trees. Huong earns a living helping him. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for six years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Huong has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy fertilizer for her trees. She always wants to have more money to improve her business and buy some furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her trees.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a farming business. She keeps poultry. Besides this, she also keeps dairy cows, practices subsistence farming, and sells tap water. The business has been running for five years. Alice has one child.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the effect of low seasons. 

Alice is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to renovate the tap area and buy more chickens for sale. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase more stock. Her desire is also to keep laying hens in the near future.

loans.use: To renovate the tap area and buy more chickens for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats and sheep in larger numbers for selling later on

loans.name: Tsolak

texts.en:
Tsolak lives in Antarashat village in the Syunik region. He lives with his wife. His daughter is married and lives with her family in Kapan. Tsolak used to work in different factories in Kapan and Kajaran, but following the collapse of the Soviet Union, industrial production in the Syunik region declined and Tsolak and his wife became unemployed. 

Now Tsolak is engaged in agriculture and farming. Tsolak’s wife helps him in his business. They have cattle and a garden where they cultivate fruit and vegetables that also serves as a pasture for cattle. Tsolak sells all his agricultural products in Kapan fruit markets. The profit from farming allows Tsolak to sustain his family.

He needs a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy a pig and calf in order to enhance his animal breeding efforts. This purchase will result in a great profit for his family.

loans.use: To buy a pig and calf

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children who are adults. She has been selling children's clothes for more than 3 years. She loves little children very much, so she wants them to be able to wear suitable clothes. Every month, she goes to the capital and buys modern and fashionable children's clothes and sells them over the course of a month in the local market of her region. 

Although she must buy goods for the new season, she does not currently have the funds to do so. If she is unable to buy the new season goods, she will lose many of her customers because her competitors have all bought the new season goods already. She is asking for a loan of 7500 somoni to buy children's clothes for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Maria Maximinia

texts.es:
María es una mujer joven de 23 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora, soltera con mucha juventud por delante y mucho que aprender en la vida. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria completo cursado hasta el 6 grado y vive bajo el mismo techo de sus padres. Ella no pudo continuar estudiando por falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres pero le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra para que ella pueda generarse ingresos para cubrir con sus gastos y con otras necesidades personales. El terreno del cual ella es propietaria está a una distancia de 200 metros al cual se traslada a pie diariamente el cual fue obtenido por una herencia de sus padres.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para sus cultivos de café ya que estos productos son caros y son necesarios para que sus cultivos estén sanos y libres de roya enfermedad que destruye cultivos completos de café y plagas.

Su meta es mantener su cultivo sano y libre de plagas y otros que lo puedan dañar para poder tener una buena cosecha y así mismo obtener buenas y mejores ganancias para re invertir en sus cultivos ya que este es su único medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Maria is a 23 year old, hardworking, enterprising, single woman with much youth ahead of her and lots to learn about life.  She has a sixth grade education and lives with her parents.  She was not able to continue studying due to a lack of financial support from her parents, but they taught her how to work the land so that she could earn an income to cover her personal needs.  The land she works belongs to her.  She inherited it from her parents and is located 200 meters away.  She walks there daily.

She is asking for help so she can buy fertilizer and compost for her coffee crop, because these items are expensive but necessary so that her crops remain healthy and free from disease that destroys coffee crops.

Her goal is to keep her crops healthy and free from disease and other things that can damage them so that she can have a good harvest and be able to have better earrings.  This is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a resident of the Mariakani area of the Coast province in Kenya. She owns a retail business which deals in the selling of charcoal and fish. Dama obtained the capital from her husband. The business has been running for the last 10 years. She is a married mother of five children.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase more dried fish and sacks of charcoal. The challenge that the business faces is inflation.

Dama will use the extra income from the loan to buy additional stock.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Armenak

texts.en:
Armenak is from Khanjyan village of the Armavir region. He is a father of two sons, and his wife is a teacher at a local school. Armenak is involved in agriculture and grows peach and apricot trees. He sells the gathered harvest locally and gets income, which is very important for sustaining the family. Armenak has been working at a local village hall for many years, but the farming business helps him to have a stable income during the month. As  the unemployment rate in the region is very high, it is very difficult for Armenak and his family to sustain their living. 

Realizing that the farming business is very important for him, Armenak would like to expand it. He has applied to SEF International for a loan. With the help of the loan, Armenak will purchase four oxen and fertilizer, which is very important for the successful cultivation of the land.

loans.use: to pay for four oxen and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is a married business lady and a mother of two children. She runs a service shop dealing in the secretarial services of printing and photocopying. The business has been in operation for nine months. She is also employed as a teacher.

Amina was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy printing and photocopy papers. She hopes to improve her living standard from the income earned through this business.

loans.use: To buy printing and photocopy papers.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 37 years old. He lives in Batumi District with his wife and 17-year-old daughter. Ramin requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is renting part of their house to foreigners and get a small monthly income, which is the only source of living for them. 

Ramin requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Ramin has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Ramin will install the water system in his greenhouse and purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer. He has already built a greenhouse and now needs to prepare land for harvesting vegetables. The harvested products will be sold at the local markets, and Ramin will earn a good profit for his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To install the water system and purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives in the village of Artsvanik; it is located in the region of Syunik. He is 56 years old, and he has a higher education, but he doesn't work. He has been engaged in farming and agriculture for many years. He is divorced and lives alone. His children are married, and they live separately with their families. 

Ashot has a garden, and he cultivates fruits, vegetables and different types of crops. He also keeps cattle and chickens on his farm. All the goods that he has from farming and agriculture he sells in Kapan and Kajaran towns to resellers. 

Ashot wants to buy three calves and hay; for this he needs 1,000,000 Armenia drams. Ashot hopes very much that Kiva will help him to enrich the quantity of his farm animals and bring him more income.

loans.use: To buy three calves and hay.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer earns a living through her gasoline retailing business. She is a married woman and a mother of two children. Jennifer is asking for a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. With this loan, she will be able to sell more and augment her income. Jennifer dreams of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married mother of four children who still go to school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a food stall business from home for the past six years, selling to passersby and neighbors. In addition, she does farming as her other source of income. She cited seasonality and theft as a challenge in the business. 

With the KSHS 45,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Mrs.Odgerel is 49 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Nergui is 51 years old and partially disabled. Her older two children go to local universities and her youngest daughter studies at the local secondary school. Odgerel has been running her tailoring service in a rented place for the last three years and now is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials and insulation materials for her workplace to stay warm during harsh Mongolian winters. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase construction material and insulation material for her workplace to stay warm during harsh Mongolian winter

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
The woman’s in the photo is Bun, a housewife and a mother of a grown up child, living together with her family in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. She is 44 years old and married to her husband who owns and runs a Tuk-Tuk business, providing transportation services to people living in the surrounding areas. Although the occupation does not allow him to make a consistent income daily, he is lucky to generate $10.00 a day on average. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy house-building materials like cement, sand, and other needed materials for partially repairing her house. Bun wanted to give her family a proper house in which to live. She is thankful for the loan that will allow her to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for another loan of KSHS 15,000 to add to her stock of water for sale that will help her to invest back into her business. In addition, she has a fuel-selling business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to add to her stock of water to sell

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot and his family have lived in the village of Syunik for over 12 years. He has three daughters and a son. Before moving to Syunik, they lived in Goris city and in the beginning it was very hard for him and his family to adapt to local living and conditions but thanks to his family members' team work, they have already overcome all difficulties.
 
Ashot and his wife are engaged in agriculture and farming. They have a piece of private land where they cultivate grapes, different vegetables and fruits. They also have some cattle. Ashot and his family are very happy since they have a good income from farming with permanent customers in Kapan who purchase their agricultural products. Ashot needs to buy three young cows and fodder for his animals, so he decided to take a loan from Nor Horizon and Kiva. The amount they need is 1.100.000 Armenia drams. This way, Ashot can enlarge his cattle breeding and receive a good profit from this deal.

loans.use: To buy three young cows and fodder for his animals

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
Bacilia es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y joven de 29 años casada con un grado de educación de primaria no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado por lo cual agradase el esfuerzo a sus padres por el apoyo brindado. Junto a su esposo tienen 5 hijos de los cuales los 2 mayores asisten a la escuela, el tercer hijo al kínder y los últimos 2 son menores. Fue hoy en día su pareja quien le enseño hace más de 3 años el cultivo de café ya que es medio de ingreso para su familia. Su producto es comercializado con los intermediarios que llegan a la zona y que la caracterizan su producto como un producto de calidad e higiénico. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio y lo adquirieron gracias a una herencia por parte de los papas de su esposo ubicado a 50 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie.

Hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas para poder darle mantenimiento al cultivo de café que hoy en día tiene sembrado.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación y mantener sanas sus cosechas ya que es el único medio de ingreso para su familia y poder cubrir los estudios de su hijo.
texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Bacilia is a plucky and enterprising young woman.  She completed only the first three years of primary school but is grateful to her parents for supporting her through them.  Bacilia has five children with her husband.  The two oldest are in school, one is in nursery and the other two are too young for any school yet.  Over three years ago, Bacilia''s husband taught her how to grow coffee as it is a source of income for the family.  They sell their product to agents who came to the area and the couple describe their product as being of good quality and clean.  The couple grow the coffee on their own land as it was left to them by Bacilia's husband's parents.  The land is 50 metres from their home, so they can get there by foot.

Bacilia is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilisers, manure and pest-control substances to maintain the coffee crop which has now been planted.

Bacilia's plan for the future is to have a bigger coffee plantation that continues to be fruitful.  She wants the crops to continue to support the family and for it to last for generations to come.  Bacilia wants the crops to remain healthy as they are the only source of income for the family and can cover the costs of her child's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure and pest-control substances to maintain her coffee plants.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don jose  es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol cuando ya esta lista su cosecha la almacena en los sacos que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a venderla en los comercios de compra- venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Don jose desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso ha solicitado un crédito el cual le permita , para seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: José is very responsible with his obligations to his household and has always tried to provide his family with the best he can.  He currently lives with his wife and son and makes a living in agriculture, sowing corn and beans.  When the harvest is ready, José stores his product - which you can see in the photo - in bags so as to later go out to sell it at the basic grains market.  With his profit, José manages to cover household costs.  José would like to increase his sales and so is applying for a loan.  This will allow him to continue to bring home a living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilisers and other items.

loans.name: Eduardo Rafael

texts.es: Eduardo de 53 años de edad, tiene una tienda miscelánea en Barranquilla, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 13 a 23 años. Su experiencia data desde hace 20, cuando observando se dio cuenta que un local que había funcionado como tienda, lo desocuparon y ella decidió organizar esa infraestructura y darse a la tarea de vender ranchos, víveres, artículos de la canasta familiar, incluyéndole productos de miscelánea,  para captar la atención, no solo de las madres de familia, sino también  de jóvenes y niños, que les gusta encontrar regalos para sus amistades. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y sus metas son las de sacar adelante su microempresa y darle una estructura educativa de calidada sus hijo, que le permita  tener éxito en la vida. En la actualidad Eduardo ha recibido dos financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará bebidas, víveres, ranchos, para reponer los productos que mas rotan en su negocio, teniendo inventarios, que satisfagan las necesidades de su clientela, para generar cada vez mas ingresos que beneficien a su familia.
texts.en: Eduardo is 53 years old and has a corner shop in Barranquilla, where he lives with his partner and three children (aged between 13 and 23 years old).  Eduardo has 20 years experience in this business, having started it when he noticed that premises that had previously housed a shop had become vacant.  He opened the shop and decided to sell food, supplies and basic staple goods, including miscellaneous products to attract attention.  This brought in not just mothers but also young people and children looking for presents for their friends.  Customers can buy on credit.  Eduardo's dream is to progress with his business and to give his children a good education that will allow them to be successful in life.  Eduardo has received two loans from the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo", which he has used to buy drinks, supplies and food to replace the products in the shop which have the highest turnover.  With good stock to satisfy customers' needs, Eduardo can generate more and more profits which will benefit his family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, supplies and food.

loans.name: Siannah

texts.en: Siannah is 20 years old and lives at Paynesville North, which has the largest local market in Montsorrade. She and her fiance live together, and her fiance is not working. They have a five-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. She described herself as a hardworking lady. Since 2008, she has been running a table market where she sells pepper, palm oil, bitter ball, etc. in the local market. She likes her business because of the way her customers respond to it. She started this business with money given to her by her oldest sister. She walks every time to buy her inventory since her market table is much closer to the local market. She sells from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM six day a week. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, palm oil, bitter ball, etc. for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a shop.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, palm oil, bitter ball etc to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He has five children, all of whom attend school. He is a construction materials supplier. The business has been running for the last five years.
 
Nelson learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high transport and fuel costs.

Nelson is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy building blocks and sand. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He hopes to own a fully stocked hardware in the future.

loans.use: To buy building blocks and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Otgonjargal is a 43-year-old single woman who lives alone in Ger in the Orhon province of Mongolia. She has been running an organic dairy products retail business at a rental counter of a local market since 2004. She has collected a lot of experience in the organic dairy products retail business over the years. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders and sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, honest and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah lives in the north area of Paynesville, which has a large local market in Montsorrade. She lives with her fiancé, who works with an NGO. They have two children together aged 16 and 19, who are both in school and living at home.

Yassah describes herself as a hard working woman. In 1999, she started a business selling salt, vita, pepper, okra etc in her community using money from her fiance. Since then, she has worked six days a week from 7am to 5pm. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to the market. She likes her business because it makes a good profit.

Yassah has asked for a loan to buy more goods for her business. With the proceeds, she plans to buy a piece of land and build a house for her family.  She would like to say thank you to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more salt, vita, pepper, okra etc for her business

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo es transportista del servicio publico, y vive con su hija en casa propia en un acabado de adobe y piso de cemento, en la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que es el único sustento de su familia.
Leonardo  requiere el crédito para  el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo para continuar trabajando  y así mantener   sus ingresos y tratar de mejorarlos.
El sueño de Leonardo es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Leonardo works in the public transport service and lives with his daughter in his own house, made out of adobe with a cement floor, in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.  He works more than eight hours a day since he is the only income earner in the family.

Leonardo is in need of a loan to pay for maintenance on his work vehicle so he can continue working to maintain his income or even try to improve it.

Leonardo's dream is to build a house someday.

loans.use: To pay for taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has four children, three of whom are going to school. 

He sells horticultural produce, e.g. mangoes, plums, passion fruit, oranges etc. He has been operating this business for four years. Apart from this business, he earns a salary as a public service vehicle driver.

Ibrahim learnt about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The main challenges he faces is the scarcity of stock and high transport costs. 

Ibrahim is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy more fruit to sell. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to expand the business, open other branches and pay for school fees. 

His future plan in five years time is to move to other bigger income generating activities.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jambal

texts.en:
Mr Jambal is 37 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Orhon province of Mongolia. His wife Amandik works at a local woollen rug manufacturing company. 

Jambal has been working at a local company as a carpenter for years and has a lot of experience in the wooden furniture manufacturing industry. He is now starting his own wooden furniture manufacturing business on his plot of land and is requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and construction material to build a small workplace on his land. 

He is a hardworking, optimistic and talented man.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and construction material to build a small workplace on his land

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a single businessman and sells tree seedlings, fruit and vegetables. He has been operating this business for four years. Apart from the tree business, he earns a salary from formal employment.

William learnt about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The main challenge he faces is the effect of dry seasons, a period when he says there is demand for water. 

William is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan shillings to buy more seeds for planting. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings, to expand the business and in turn improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more seeds for planting.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 58-year-old widow and mother of four children. She has been working in her convenience store since 2002, to cover her family's expenses since her husband passed away.

Maryam is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise with special summer beverages, that will be sure to increase her income and develop her livelihood.

Maryam will also help with her daughter's livelihood. Most of her customers are relatives, friends and neighbours. Maryam is well known in her region and supported by her customers because she is living for her children's needs.

She hopes to open another branch in the future and increase her income.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special summer beverages

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is involved in agriculture. She keeps a cow, 30 chickens and owns agricultural land, where she cultivates wheat and tomatoes and grows a variety of trees (peach, apricot, cherry, plum, nut, apple and pear).

Nelli is a mother of three sons who, jointly with their mother, are running a farm. They work hard to gather good harvests and their father sells it locally.

The income from the agricultural business is very important for Nelli and her family and she would like to expand it. Nelli has applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer, which is very important for the successful cultivation of the land.

The loan is very important for Nelli to enlarge her farm and gather more income.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 50 years old and lives at Paynesville North, which has the largest local market in Montsorrade. She is a junior high school dropout. She’s married and has ten children between 14 and 34 years old, with only one in school and living at home. She describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past four years she has been selling rice, palm oil, pepper, etc. in the local market. She likes her business because of the way her customers respond to it. She started this business with money given to her by mother. She shares a taxi to enable her to get her goods to her table at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, etc. for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, etc  for her business.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of one child and runs a food stall, which has been in operation for nine years. She also has a salon. 

Riziki was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables, sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc.

Despite the high cost of purchase and a few bad debts, Riziki believes she can save the extra income, provide a means of income to the other employees and also use part of the money to open a larger cafe or a hotel.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc.

loans.name: Mtawali

texts.en:
Mtawali lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a married father of six and owns a food stall, which he has been operating for six years.

He learnt about Milango through friends, who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and the effect of season changes. 

Mtawali is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy food stocks, like vegetables, rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children and improve his living standard. 

His dream is to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy food stocks, like vegetables, rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat etc.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Mrs Narangerel is 49 years old and lives with her husband in Ger in the Orhon province of Mongolia. 

She has been working as a tailor in a private company since 1997. She has gained a lot of experience and customers over the years. She has been tailoring traditional and modern clothes at home to order during her spare time since 2008. 

She is now planning to start her own business at home and is requesting 3,500,000MNT to purchase a large amount of supplies to start her tailoring business at home. 

She is a hardworking and positive woman, who has a good record with her previous loans at XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of supplies to start her tailoring business at home

loans.name: Pastus

texts.en:
Pastus is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He runs a veterinary supplies shop, which has been in operation for the last 2 years. 

Pastus was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit to improve his business. He is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy plant seeds, pesticides and fertilizers to sell.

He looks forward to improving his living standards from the extra income earned through this loan.

loans.use: To buy plant seeds, pesticides and fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 63-year-old widow, she has been selling religious clothes for twenty two years.

She is a Palestinian refugee, who puts a lot of effort into developing her business, in order to improve her living standards.

Fatima is a hard worker, who insists on pleasing her customers as much as she can, to make sure that they will stay attracted and loyal to her.

Fatima is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to improve her underwear and lingerie section, to ensure that her customers will always find what they are looking for.

Fatima hopes to keep on diversifying her products to make sure that her business will continue to expand to cover her needs.

loans.use: To improve her underwear section

loans.name: Lubatoy

texts.en: Lubatoy is a smart and hardworking woman. She is a 39-year-old woman who is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a migrant worker in a foreign country. They must do this to provide their children with all the modern conveniences. She has been busy with farming but only receives a small income from this business. She decided to organize a new business by sewing national women dresses, as this kind of service has a great demand in her region. She took a course called ‘To get ahead’ at a woman’s organization and learned enough skills about how to organize business. She does not have enough money to buy new sewing machine and to develop the business. She is asking for a loan of 1500 TJS to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Galib

texts.en:
This is Galib's second loan. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.
Galib is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He now lives in the Fuzuli region, Bala-Bahmanli which is close to the occupied border. Galib is 36 years old, married, and has two children, a 6-year-old son and a new born daughter. His son goes to school and wants to play sports. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. He started his agriculture business 6 years ago.
Now Galib needs a 2,000 AZN loan to increase and repair the stall for his cows. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help his family. In the future, Galib wants to have more cows at his farm. This will be more profitable for his business.

loans.use: to repair the stall for his cows.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a retail shop, a business which she has been running for two years.
Betty learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is inflation.
Betty is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy stock of maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her child. She aspires to set up a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jackmix

texts.en: Jackmix is grateful for the loans he has received through Milango. His children are obtaining an education as well as other basic needs. He would however like to improve on the quality of services offered by his barber shop. Jackmix is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings to renovate the business area, buy stock of shavers and some cosmetics. He believes the business has improved and will be able to meet the required repayments besides helping provide for his family.

loans.use: to renovate the business area, buy stock of shavers and some cosmetics.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 44-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling plastic products eight years ago. 

Farzana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a new molding machine for making plastic goods. 

He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Farzana hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a molding machine for manufacturing plastic products.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man, aged 25. His children are aged between three and one year old. Samuel is a motorcycle operator and also owns a retail shop in Koibatek.

He is servicing his second loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase stocks of sugar, tea leaves, washing soaps and detergents as well as other stock for his shop.  

The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his retail business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 34 years old, married to Nancy and they have three children who are in school. He has a tailoring business in Naivasha which he has operated for one year.
He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy fabric for making clothes. With the anticipated profit, he hopes to expand his business and pay school fees.
He hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak is kind and smart woman. She is married and has a daughter who is 23 years old. They live together happily but poorly.
Her husband is a worker and has a small income. She has been busy sewing more than 20 years. She has much experience with sewing. Her experiences and skills help her to be perfect in this business. She has her own clients. Currently, she wants to develop her business. She wants to work together with her daughter so her daughter can help her with sewing. She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and fabrics. She awaits your support. This is her first loan and she hopes that this loan will be useful for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabrics for developing her business.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 20-year-old young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family. Firas's mother works as an employee in the local sector. She would like help buy a new laptop for her son. This laptop will help Firas to do his homework and reports.
Firas took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help Firas in his studies and in his future life.
Firas appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old young man from Tulkarm City. He works at his own bakery.
Ahmad would like to expand his business by buying a car for delivering and distributing bread to the supermarkets and restaurants.
Ahmad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a car for his business and increase his income.
Ahmad appears in the photo beside his car.

loans.use: to buy a car for his bakery.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif is a 28-year-old single man from Rafah City. He has worked as a lawyer for a few years. Sharif would like to buy a new laptop for his job. This laptop will be very useful to him to do his work in less time.
Sharif took an $800 Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help Sharif to buy a new laptop for his job and maybe in the future he will buy a copier and printer.
Sharif appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his law office.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Don adan  vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y maicillo, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso  solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas,  insecticida, herbicida, etc.  Don adan  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Adan lives with his partner and daughter in their own home.  He grows crops such as corn, beans and sorghum and has worked in agriculture for several years.  The experience gained has allowed him to achieve better harvests.  He sells his crops around the community and has many customers who prefer his quaity, low prices and good service.

Adan is requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.  He has a good credit record among his acquaintances, is very responsible and committed to paying back the loan on time.  He trusts he will be able to give his household economic security.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente  vive con su familia en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, cuando ha pasado la cosecha trabaja de jornal en una finca que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia,  con las ventas que realiza de sus granos básicos y con el pago de su trabajo  ayuda en los gasto de su casa. El cliente solicita un crédito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas, etc.  y  poder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
The borrower lives with his family in their own home and he has been involved in agriculture for several years.  When the harvest season is over he works on a farm near his residence.  Between the money he makes from selling basic grains and the money earned working, he helps cover household expenses.

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc. to improve his crop and income so he can continue helping with expenses at home.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en:
Fawzi is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his son appears in his Kiva profile photo.
Fawzi is a 59-year-old married man with one son and two daughters. He lives in a small village near Rafah City. Fawzi has owned a sewing workshop for ten years which is a very profitable business. This is the only source of income for the family.
Fawzi would like to buy a new laptop for his business to record all the financial transactions.
Fawzi took a $450 loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to control all his financial transactions and improve his sewing workshop.
Fawzi’s son is photographed in the workshop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his sewing workshop.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 42 years old and lives the Paynesville South, an area which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband works as a security guard. They have four children between the ages of 4 and 24 years old, with only one living at home and attending school. Comfort was unfortunate not to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. For the past three years she has been selling pepper, rice, vita palm oil etc. in the local market. Now she faces no problems, she sells every day and spends 12 hours at her business. She started this business with a little income she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, and vita palm oil for her business. She hopes to build a house one day.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, and vita palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 47-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and is the mother of four children. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He purchases cattle and goats to sell in the market at a profitable price. He needs additional capital to purchase cattle and goats to sell. However, due to financial constraints, he finds this difficult.

Therefore his wife, Rukhsana, has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will enable her to help her husband, who wants to maintain the farm with the profits he earns. Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and goats to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is from Nakuru. She owns rental houses and a stationery shop. She has applied for a second loan from KADET LTD to enable her start a grocery shop. 

Gladys paid her previous loan on time. With the anticipated profits, she hopes to open another stationery shop. She also hopes to buy another plot of land in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock such as vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo tiene 31 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, vive en una casa alquilada a lado de su esposa, padres y hermanos.Gerardo administra un gimnasio, negocio familiar que tiene hace más de 5 años,el brinda las clases de Spinning a sus clientes, al principio por el trabajo que tenía no podía darse tiempo para manejar el negocio, pero gracias a Dios ahora tiene el tiempo y las ganas de aportar para que siga surgiendo y mejorar su pequeña empresa. Fue su madre quien tuvo la iniciativa de poner un negocio propio para generar sus propios ingresos, en un principio otra persona manejaba la pequeña empresa, pero poco a poco Gerardo fue incorporándose y ahora es el quien está a cargo del gimnasio.Gerardo espera seguir creciendo, implementar y mejorar la infraestructura del local para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.Este es el primer crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecido por el apoyo económico recibido, ya que le dará el capital para que compre máquinas y mejore la infraestructura del local.Con el monto solicitado de S/.3000 soles comprará máquinas para hacer ejercicios y fierros para el gimnasio.
texts.en: Gerardo is 31 years old and he is a very hardworking and responsible young man; he pays rent for the house where he lives with his wife, his parents and his siblings. Gerardo runs a gym, a family activity that has been in business for 5 years, and he gives spinning classes to his customers. At first he had lot of work to do and did not have time to also manage the gym, but he thanks God because now he has enough time and desire to contribute to his gym so that it can keep on growing and improving. It was his mother who took the initiative to open an activity of their own, in order to earn a living, and at first there was another person in charge of this small activity; but then Gerardo started to get involved little by little, and now it's him who directs the gym. Gerardo hopes to keep on progressing, and to implement and improve the infrastructure of the gym in order to give a better service to his customers. This is the first loan he is requesting to Kiva, and he feels deeply grateful for the economic support he has received, because this will grant him the working capital he needs to buy machines and to improve the infrastructure of his working space. The 3000 PEN loan he is requesting will be used to buy exercise machines and gymnastic tools.

loans.use: To buy exercise machines and gymnastic tools.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 52 años de edad, es un hombre responsable y vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en la casa que le heredarón sus padres. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, en todo este tiempo pudo sembrar distintos alimentos como habas, papas, alverjas y demás hortalizas, “siembro la mayor parte de los alimentos”, afirma. Por ello se siente muy dichoso al ver como sus cosechas son muy cotizadas entre los comerciantes de la localidad. Alfredo, siembra en extensas hectáreas de terreno agrícola, que fueron heredados por parte de sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que hoy sabe del campo. Cuenta que tienen que invertir un promedio de 7 mil a 10 mil soles para comenzar a sembrar, por ello le resulta un poco difícil conseguir la totalidad del capital, ya que es la única actividad con la que solventa sus gastos económicos. Ahora desea incrementar sus ganancias para poseer un capital mayor y de esa manera sembrar en mayor cantidad. Aprovecha su trabajo para la crianza de ovejas, vacas y toros que engorda para luego vender a los carniceros.Este es el segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado motivo por el cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Alfredo, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 52, is a responsible man who lives with his wife and children in the house they inherited from his parents.  For 30 years he has been working in agriculture and growing different kinds of food such as lima beans, potatoes, peas and other vegetables.  "I grow almost everything.", he claims.  He is thrilled to see that his crops command a very good price among the merchants in the town.  Alfredo has quite a large plantation that he inherited from his parents who taught him everything he knows.  He says he must invest between 7,000 and 10,000 PEN to begin planting, and it is a little difficult to come up with so much capital because agriculture is his ownly source of income.

Now he wants to increase his profits to earn more, so the only way to do that is by planting more crops.  He takes advantage of his work to raise sheep and cattle that he later sells to butchers.  This is his second Kiva loan and he is very grateful for the financial support.  He is committed to paying it back on time.

The loan in the amount of 2,500 PEN will be used to buy organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su esposa y su  hija en casa propia, el tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hotdog  sus productos los anda un carretón porque trabaja de forma ambúlate en las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene varios años de trabajar en esa actividad y tiene mucha clientela pues los vende a precios muy accesible, el cliente solicita un crédito para comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios como: panes, mayonesa, salsa de tomate, aguacates, mortadelas , salchichas, etc. y asi poder seguir llevando el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
This client lives with his wife and daughter in their own house. He has his own business selling pies and hotdogs, and sells his products from a cart as he travels to different neighborhoods around his home. He has worked in this business for several years and has a lot of customers due to his affordable prices.   

He is requesting this loan to purchase all of the necessary ingredients such as bread, mayonnaise, tomato salsa, avocado, baloney, sausage, etc., so that he can continue to provide the daily bread to sustain his household.

loans.use: to purchase bread, mayonnaise, tomato salsa, avocado, baloney, sausage, etc.

loans.name: William Arnoldo

texts.es: William de 33 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus dos  hijos. William está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una  mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
William, 33, has worked in agriculture for many years. He grows beans and corn and with the sales he makes, he manages to cover the home expenses. William is a responsible, honest and hardworking man who lives with his wife and two children. 

William is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his crops, such as fertilizers, compost and seeds, since he does not make enough to pay for them. This way, he will have a better income and a more stable economy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Manne Group

texts.fr: La cliente Wamunzila est conseillère du groupe de crédit « Manne », entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 53 ans, mère de 12 enfants, qui étudient tous et d’autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. La cliente est une assistante infirmière. Elle est propriétaire d’une officine pharmaceutique. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter nouveaux produits (Médicaments). Les taxes, tracasseries policières et administratives sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, construire sa maison et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Wamunzila, the customer, is an adviser to the loan group "Manne" and a courageous entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and the mother of 12 children who all study, and others who already have their own households. Her spouse is a driver and she is an assistant nurse. She is the owner of a pharmacy. She started this business with funds she received from her husband. This new loan will be used to buy new products (medicines). Taxes, legal and administrative problems are major obstacles to the development of her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a home and make sure that her children get an education. She would like to thank Hekima for its financial support in the form of microloans given to female entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of medicine.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Darive M.

texts.en:
Darive is 31 years old and lives in Paynesville South, which is one of the more populated areas in Montserrado County. She and her fiancee live together, and her fiance is a taxi driver. They have an 8-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. She describes herself as a hardworking person.

For the past four years, Darive has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells rice and soup in the local market. She likes her business because of the way her customers respond to it. She started this business with money given to her by her oldest sister. She walks every day to buy her ingredients since her shop is much closer to the local market.

Darive is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, dry meat, etc. for her restaurant business. In the future, she plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thank you to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia, enabling small business owners to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, dry meat, etc. for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en:
Sabri is a 57-year-old married man from Jenin City. He is the father of one son and three daughters. 

Sabri was a local sector worker and now he is retired. He would like to improve his home by buying new furniture and some home appliances.
