For this reason, Sabri took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Sabri to improve his home and his living conditions by buying new furniture and home appliances.

Sabri appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and home appliances.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years old and married to Joseph. They have three children who are in school. She operates a cereal business in Nakuru.
She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her pay school fees. She paid her previous loans on time. With the anticipated profit, she hopes to add more stock to her business.
She hopes to open a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for electricity installation in her salon.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 36-year-old married woman, and mother of four children. She has been working at selling accessories, beauty cosmetics and fruits and vegetables since 2006. Rania is person that is able to multitask. She works hard to provide her family with their necessary needs, since her husband's work is not stable at all.
Today Rania is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her fruits and vegetables stock as well as her underwear stock.  This will allow her to provide her customers with their variety of needs.
In this way, Rania created the need for some items among her customers, and in that way they visit her for a certain needs and just recognize that they need the other items too.
She hopes to keep on expanding and diversifying her products in this way and that one day she can open a separate department for each sector.

loans.use: to increase her fruits and vegetables stock as well as her stock of underwear.

loans.name: Diturie

texts.en:
Diturie is a married Egyptian Albanian and in her early sixties. She is married and has two grown children. In addition to raising her own children, she is now taking care of her nephew who was abandoned by his parents some time ago.
While the Egyptian community usually lives in the urban areas, some of them in south-central Albania have chosen to live in the rural areas these past twenty years, after the collapse of the communist regime. They find more opportunities in the rural areas and a better life even though difficult, according to them.
Diturie is requesting a loan to buy pesticides. She has been in agriculture for the past four years and she has been selling fresh produce at the local market in the nearby main city.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her planted veggies and grains.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Ms. Robina is a 41-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. She has been running a business of selling fabrics for the past 6 years. She purchases a variety of ladies’ fabrics from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become well known for selling good quality fabrics in various colors and designs. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different colorful fabrics in various designs by taking in account the demands of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. Robina dreams of giving good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different colorful fabrics in various designs by taking in account the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Bendiara Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAMSETOU représente le groupe BENDIARA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans et le moins âgé 15ans. 04 vont à l’école et elle a 07 Personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend des cartes de recharges, gère un secrétariat public (saisie, photocopie) depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne avec les revendeurs et au grand marché. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes. 
Mme veut s’acheter des fournitures de bureau (08carton de rames de papier, 09 lots de chemises et 06 botes de Bic).
Elle épargne ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne toujours améliorer son activité, employer plus de personnel et aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Hamsetou represents the Bendiara group. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of 4 children. The eldest is 24 years old and the youngest, 15. All of her children go to school and she is also responsible for 7 more people. She sells prepaid charge cards and has been running a secretarial services business (data entry, photocopies) for 12 years. She gets her supplies from the resellers and at the Grand Market. Her customers are men and women. 

She would like to buy office supplies (8 reams of paper, 9 batches of folders and 6 boxes of BIC pens). She saves the profits that she earns. She still aims to improve her business, to employ more people and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy office supplies (8 reams of paper, 9 batches of folders and 6 boxes of BIC pens).

loans.name: Manne-Sg Group

texts.fr: La cliente Pandabilima est conseillère du groupe de crédit « Manne-SG », entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 42 ans, mère de 10 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un commerçant. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers usés. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Il y a 24 ans, qu’elle fait ce commerce.  Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 15 ballons de souliers. La crise financière, l’insécurité dans la région sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Pandabilima, the customer, is an adviser to the loan group "Manne-SG". She is a brave entrepreneur who is 42 years old and the mother of 10 children who all attend school. Her spouse is a merchant and she sells second-hand shoes. She started this business with funds received from her husband and has been in business for 24 years. This new loan will be used to buy 15 bales of shoes. Both the financial crisis and the insecurity in the region are major obstacles to the development of her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and take care of her children's education. She would also like to thank Hekima for the financial support it gives female entrepreneurs in the form of microloans.

loans.use: to buy 15 bales of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tiessiri est composé de six  femmes qui sont majoritairement des mariées et monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce d’ustensile et des glacières. 
Dans le but de consolider leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Marietou (2ème femme debout de la  droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’ustensiles de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une douzaine de tasse et des glacières à prix abordable chez son fournisseur à Bobo-Dioulasso. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit dans la ville de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Marietou  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.000 FCFA, qui sera investi dans l’activité. Son objectif est de pérenniser son activité dans le partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is made up of six women, the majority of whom are married and monogamous. They average 35 years of age and have an average of three children each. They all live in the town of Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region) and got to know each other through neighbors and relatives. They have small businesses selling utensils and ice-boxes.

With a view to consolidating their small businesses, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan clycle.

Marietou (standing second from the right in the photo) is a significant seller of all sorts of utensils. She is planning to use her loan to buy a dozen cups and ice-boxes at an affordable price from her supplier in Bobo-Dioulasso. She resells for cash and on credit in the town of Ségou to a customer base made up of men and women. Marietou expects to make an average monthly profit of 17,000 FCFA, which will be invested in her business. Her aim is to keep her business going in the long term in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy utensils.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She has been running a business selling used clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city at wholesale rates and, after doing proper cleaning and ironing, she then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community.

Razia requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistani rupees from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different clothes in various sizes and designs taking into account the choices of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different clothes of various sizes and designs, taking into account the choices of her customers.

loans.name: Famatta

texts.en:
Famatta is 43 years old and lives in Paynesville South, which is one of the populous areas in Montserrado County. She and her fiancée live together, and her fiancée is a house builder. They both have five children, who are in school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past five years, she has been selling rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc., in the local market. She likes her business because of the way customers respond to it. She started her business with money given to her by her husband. By means of shared taxi, she gets her goods to her market table.

Famatta is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc., for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc., for her business

loans.name: Fernándo

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 51 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene seis hijos de 28, 25, 22, 17, 13 y 10 años de edad respectivamente. Tiene 40 años de dedicarse a realizar trabajos agrícolas; oficio que aprendió con su padre. Estudio hasta el ercer grado desde entonces solo a trabajado en el campo. Para comprar los insumos tiene que viajar durante 20 kilómetros para realizar sus compras. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 8 sacos de abono, 12 sacos de fertilizantes y pago de alquiler de 14,000 metros cuadrados para cultivar maíz. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha que le permita comprar lo necesario para su familia, mejorando sus condiciones actuales. Su deseo es construir su casa de adobe y más grande para que sus hijos tengan más privacidad.
texts.en:
Fernando is 51 years old and lives with his six children, who are 28, 25, 22, 17, 13 and 10 respectively. He has worked in agriculture for 40 years, a trade he learnt from his father. He was in school until the third grade, since when he has worked in the fields. To buy supplies he has to travel 20km to do his shopping.

Fernando has asked Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy 8 sacks of manure and 12 sacks of fertiliser, and to pay rent on 14,000 square metres of land for growing corn. This means will have a good harvest which will allow him to buy what his family needs and to improve their current situation. Fernando's dream is to be able to build a house out of bricks that is large enough for his children to have more privacy.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of manure and 12 sacks of fertiliser and to pay rent on 14,000 square metres of land for growing corn.

loans.name: Gs Nobre Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATOUMATA est la responsable du groupe  GS NOBRE. Elle se porte très bien.  Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19 ans et le moins âgé a 10 ans. 03vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des condiments en gros depuis 14ans. Elle s’approvisionne  sur place car les grossistes viennent les livrer. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 04 sacs de concombre ; 05 sacs d’oignons ; 03 sacs de poivrons  et 03 sacs de courgettes. 
Mme épargne ses économies  et ambitionne  toujours agrandir son commerce et avoir le monopole.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is the leader of the GS Nobre group. She is doing very well. She is married and the mother of 4 children. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest, 10. Three of her children go to school and she is responsible for 6 people. She has been selling condiments wholesale for 14 years. She gets her supplies locally as the wholesalers deliver them. Her customers are men and women.

She would like to buy 4 bags of cucumbers, 5 bags of onions, 3 bags of peppers and 3 bags of courgettes. She saves her profits and still aims to expand her business and become the sole supplier in the area.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of cucumbers, 5 bags of onions, 3 bags of peppers and 3 bags of courgettes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de cinq  femmes qui sont mariées  et  qui vivent majoritairement dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sebougou dans la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités de commerce, de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois  et du savon. 
Dans le but de consolider leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia (1ere femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de bois de chauffe  de toute  qu’elle achète à Djoni chez les bucherons à prix abordable. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 12 chargements de charrettes en  bois de chauffe. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit dans la ville de Segou sur place à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Rokia  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA, qui sera investi dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants. Son objectif est de pérenniser son activité dans le partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of 5 women who are married and mostly live in monogamous families. They have an average age of 32 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in the Sebougou district of Ségou town (4th administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other via their businesses and thanks to neighbourly and family relationships. They sell firewood, charcoal and soap. In order to consolidate their small retail businesses, the group members decided to work together with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Rokia (sitting on the far left in the picture) is a large reseller of firewood that she buys in Djoni from woodcutters for a reasonable price. She plans to use her loan to buy 12 cartloads of firewood. She makes her sales for cash or credit locally in Ségou town to a clientèle made up of men and women. Rokia expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to take care of her children. Her aim is to make her business sustainable while working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: At the age of 56, Perveen is an energetic married woman. She is the mother of two and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, health and education. She has had a business making elastic for many years. She knows very well the method for making good quality elastic from threads and rubbers. She receives orders from the people in her community and from the local market and makes enough with her business. To meet the demands of her customers on time, she applied for her second loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase stock of elastic threads, rubber and polyester yarn. She is hopeful she'll get an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of elastic threads, rubber and polyester yarn.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is 39 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. She has been tailoring as a business for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if only her husband works for the family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household and the educational needs of their children. That is why Parveen started tailoring at home to support her family well. 

Parveen, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more reels of thread and packages of buttons and lace. In this way she will be able to complete the orders of her customers on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Parveen hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread and packages of buttons and lace

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Ms. Shamim is a 36-year-old married woman. For many years, she has been successfully running a business of selling milk to the people of her community. Over time, Shamim has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Shamim is requesting a loan of Rs. 35,000 through the Kashf Foundation to purchase more buffaloes. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more buffaloes.

loans.name: Shingimizi Group

texts.fr:
Alice fait partie du groupe  Shingimizi et   habite à Gitega. Elle a 30 ans et est mariée  à J. Marie, un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de  10 mois  à  7 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de  bière de banane  depuis 4 ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de bidons de bière de banane   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle ,y  bâtir une maison  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Alice is a member of the Shingimizi group and lives in Gitega. She is 30 years old and married to J.Marie, a builder. The couple have 3 children together, aged between 10 months and 7 years. Alice has been selling banana beer for 4 years. This is her 7th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy many cans of banana beer for resale, so that she can earn more. In the years to come, she would like to buy a large plot of land and build a house on it, and see her children get an education.

loans.use: to buy many cans of banana beer for resale.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Ms. Rukhsana is a 48-year-old woman and a loving mother of four children. Her husband deals in the business of selling wood, but his income is insufficient to meet their family expenditures. 

To meet her household expenses and provide a bright future for their children, Rukhsana decided to start her own business of stitching clothes from her home eight years ago. She is an expert in stitching stylish and unique designs and makes enough income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. So she contacted Kashf Foundation for a loan of Rs 30,000. 

Rukhsana intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials such as spools of thread in different colors and packages of laces and zippers to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread in different colors and packages of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Ms. Rubina is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. For the past 20 years, she has been successfully running a business of milk selling in her community. She has three buffaloes and has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Rubina requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase one more buffalo. She is hopeful to increase her net income through her larger sales, which will ultimately help bring in more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Raeifa

texts.en: Raeifa is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been working as a tailor and in handmade souvenirs for the past 24 years. She is well known in her region with her good reputation and special talent in her domain. Raeifa applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tailoring goods with new released items, which will help her to be more creative and reply to her customers' needs and requests. She hopes to stay in good health to keep on helping her beloved husband in making their living and securing their old age needs.

loans.use: to buy necessary tailoring goods with new released items.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Ms. Shahida is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She with her husband is doing work of agriculture for the past six years. The man shown in the photo is Shahida's husband. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, Shahida applied a loan of Rs. 30,000. This will help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history; she is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Rispa

texts.en:
Rispa is a 39-year-old mother from Migori County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Oindo, who is a businessman. She supports five people in her family and is blessed with four children: ages 18, 16, 13 and 8 years old.

Rispa has a green grocery store at the market. She has been doing this business for the last two years and makes a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings. She has applied for her first loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to purchase more stock of onions for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her dream is to educate her children and to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase onions in large scale for resale

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Ms Sadia is a 24-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers, who regularly shop at her store. Sadia makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully-stocked she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 that she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. This way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Sadia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Ms. Yasmeen is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their two children. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for four years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Ms Shazia aged 35, is a mother of six children. Three years ago, she established a small store in her home with the support of Kashf Foundation. When she started her business, her store was small and had very few items. She wanted to increase the range of products, but lacked funds made this almost impossible. Shazia borrowed some funds from Kashf in anticipation of business improvement. Over the passage of time, she been injecting the store with new items and now it has become popular in the community. She wants to increase her inventory as the population in her neighborhood has increased in the recent years. Currently she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase stock of grains, pulses and sugar. It would help her to deal to more customers without fail.

loans.use: to purchase stock of grains, pulses and sugar.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Ms Shahnaz is a 36-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues, so that she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support. She dreams of providing a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: Ms Kubra is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a mother to six children; five of them are school-going. She has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for the past five years. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to people in her vicinity along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. Because of the good quality of milk, the demand is increasing day-by-day. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy one more buffalo to increase the production of milk. She expects boost in her earnings and wishes to spend a part of the revenues on the expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to get increase in the production capacity of milk.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en: Ms. Sumaira is a 23-year-old widow and the loving mother of two children. She is a hardworking mother, who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of thread in different colors with packs of zippers, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Ms Shahida is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has gained years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs.35, 000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 35-year-old married man with three children; he also looks after two orphans. He is teacher by profession and it is from teaching that he earns a living. In 2010, Godfrey realized that there was a need for a nursery school in his village. He took it upon himself to start up a nursery school so as to help poor parents have their children attend school at a low cost near their homes. Young pupils were traveling long distances in search for schools and his initiative has helped many in the village.

Godfrey now wants a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings to buy construction materials; especially, cement and sand to plaster the building so as to improve the environment his pupils are studying in. His dream is to develop the school and have classes up to primary seven, providing quality primary education at a low cost for the children in his village. He faces various challenges including late payment and at times non-payment of school fees by parents, which makes the operations very difficult. He ends up using his own money to keep the school running and pay the teachers.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster the nursery school block.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, age 48 years old, is married and has seven children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for the children.

For the past ten years, he has operated a butchery business. He sells meat to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge in the business is seasonality and transportation of the animals to his place of work.

With the Ksh 15,000 he wants to purchase a new weighing machine for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a new weighing machine for his business.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman and she has kids who attend school. Her husband is a farmer, and together they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She is operating a motorcycle transportation business. Her potential clients are both women and men. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Priscillia

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 40-year-old mother from Kakamega county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Wycliffe, who is a business man, and is blessed with three children who are 15, 10 and seven.

She sells cereals, a business she has been doing for the last eight years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 35,000. Priscilla is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase maize, beans and millet in large quantity for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business and to pay school fees.

Her dream is to become a supplier of cereals and to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock of maize, beans and millet.

loans.name: Isunga Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Berna (lady in picture standing on the extreme end of the front row wearing a blue outfit) is a 50-year-old widow with seven children, all of whom stay with her. After the death of her husband, she was left as the sole provider for her children. She started growing crops, both to provide food for them and to sell the surplus to raise money for looking after them.

Berna wants a loan of 200,000/= (two hundred thousand shillings) to improve on her garden and ultimately provide more food for her family. Her dream is to earn enough additional income to be able to educate her children and have a decent living environment for them. However, she faces the usual challenges of limited capital as well as the erratic heavy rains and dry spells in their area that always affect her crop.

loans.use: to improve on her garden

loans.name: Polycarp

texts.en:
Polycarp is a 54-year-old married man with 10 children, three of whom are currently going to school, plus one additional dependent. He is a farmer, mainly involved in tea growing and coffee in the outskirts of Kagadi town. He has been doing this business of agriculture since 1998, being his major source of income to look after the family.

Polycarp wants a loan of 2,500,000/= (two million and five hundred thousand shillings) to buy fertilizers for his tea plantation and pesticides for spraying his tea. Since it is a rainy season, he anticipates to have a bigger harvest after applying the fertilizers to the plantation.

Polycarp's dream is to expand his tea plantation and also buy a motor vehicle to enable him transport the tea leaves to the factories he supplies. His biggest challenge is the ever changing weather which comes with very heavy rain and then dry spells that mean he has to look for water during the dry season, and this affects his yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his tea and coffee gardens.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 29-year-old lady from the Lambwe region. She is a single mother of one child who is three years old.

She has a hardware store where she sells varieties of building materials. She has been operating this kind of business for the last seven years and makes a monthly income of KES. 25,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase stocks of cement, spades, nails and timber in large volumes for resale. 


She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur within her location and educate her child.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cement, spades, timber and roofing nails.

loans.name: Kitiya

texts.en:
Kitiya is a licensed cosmetologist, esthetician, makeup artist and overall beauty guru. She received training and experience at Vidal Sassoon, Aveda, and Elizabeth Arden’s Red Door Spa. In 2007, Kitiya founded Mischobeauty.com, a beauty-centric website, with followers all over the world who read Kitiya’s beauty product reviews and learn more about the world of beauty.  

Kitiya has an academic background in chemistry. Her goal is to combine her passions for chemistry and beauty by launching her first nail polish product line. Kitiya sees the nail polish line as the first of many opportunities for her business.
 
Kitiya first started working on developing her nail polish line five or six years ago. After the birth of her son, Kitiya began reading the labels on her nail polish and noticed the number of harsh chemicals in the bottle. Kitiya will develop a 5-FREE formula, meaning the nail polish will not have any of the five common toxins. 

Kitiya is currently working with one of the largest laboratories and manufacturers of quality nail polish. Kitiya needs $8,000 to fill the order with the lab, professionally photograph the products, and build the e-commerce page of her website.

Kitiya’s long-term goal is to write a beauty book and open her own beauty school.

loans.use: to develop her own line of toxin-free nail polish.

loans.name: Erisam

texts.en:
Erisam (male pictured in photo with his credit officer) is 45 years old and married, with five children who are all school-going. He also has two dependents who are his parents, and because they are old he has to look after them. He is a primary teacher by profession and his salary is his major source of income. He also does some farming to provide food at home, and he sells the surplus to supplement his salary.

Because of his big family, the salary cannot provide all their needs, so he wants a loan of 1,200,000/= (one million and two hundred thousand shillings) to pay tuition fees for his son at the university so that he can sit for his exams. Erisam says that he has failed to raise money to pay all the fees.

His dream is to see his son and all his other children complete their education and be successful.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his son at the university.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family (sister). She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She works from her home six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the transportation of bags of charcoal up to her home. 

She is aspiring of owning a delivery van to ease transportation and also to educate her children up to university.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married. Her husband is working as a driver.

She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital, so she felt better when she applied for her first loan.

Rosa is taking a loan of $1,200 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as clothes, shoes and bags. She is happy with TRM because it offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
This is Leonisa, 58 years-old and a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Leonisa operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing such as uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed for her business. 

Leonisa hopes that her business will grow larger and that she will have more customers. She dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is a 30 year-old married man who has three children and lives in Lumbayao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. To support his family, he harvests his coconut and sells copra and other products from his coconut land earning 7,500.00 a month.

Last year, he joined Kiva partner GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services and recently requested the amount of 40,000.00 PHP in order to purchase additional coconut growing land nearby.  In the near future, Glenn wants to have another coco land for them to have doubled their income in order to be able to send their children to school and finish studies.

loans.use: to buy land to grow coconuts.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is Angela. Her previous loan was a big help for her business as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her income helped their family with their everyday expenses. She has done this business for 43 long years already. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan in order for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angela hopes that her business will grow and that she will have additional income. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 45 años de edad, esta casado y tiene cinco hijos de 19, 17, 14,12 y 9 años de edad respectivamente. Tiene 20 años de dedicarse a sembrar maíz y fríjol, antes era parte de un grupo de la guerra en el país. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla de plátano, pagar un tractor para que prepare el terreno y sembrar 2,700 plantas de plátano en 7,000 metros cuadrados para obtener la cosecha el próximo año.  Sin el financiamiento don Miguel no podrá sembrar, ya que no dispone del dinero para hacerlo por su propia cuenta. Manifiesta que tiene unas ganas inmensas de trabajar; pero necesita el apoyo financiero para recibir ingresos para la alimentación de su familia. Él planea sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados del terreno, aprovechando que el gobierno le regalo un sistema de regadillo por aspersión y ya lo tiene instalado.
texts.en:
45-year old Miguel is married and has five children aged 19, 17, 14, 12, and 9. He has earned his living for the last twenty years growing corn and beans; before that he was part of a group in the war.

The loan that Miguel is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy banana plants and pay for a tractor which he will use to prepare the ground and plant 2,700 banana plants in 7,000 m2. They will be ready to harvest next year. Without this money Miguel will not be able to do this work as he doesn’t have enough money of his own. He is very eager to do this but needs the necessary financing so he will have an income to feed his family.

He plans to plant 14,000 m2, as the government provided him with a watering system which he has already had installed.

loans.use: buy banana plants and pay for a tractor to prepare the ground

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca operates a fruits and vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
For the past years, Stella has operated a green grocery shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other green groceries. She dreams of establishing a fruits parlor in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting she has wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business,she says thanks to Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su joven hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias de la vida, se separó de su esposa, pero él dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hija, Miguel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que deseaba, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver pelicular y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Cau Cau para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Miguel trabaja como ayudante en una panadería, el se encarga de mezclar la masa y de hornear los panes, Miguel trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de los servicios higiénicos de su vivienda, ya que desea mejorar el lavadero y comprar materiales para acondicionar la ducha, de esta manera Miguel podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia panadería.
texts.en:
42-year-old Miguel lives in the city of Pisco with his young daughter who he loves dearly.  Miguel is a very friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic man.  Sadly, for a number of reasons, he separated from his wife but he now puts all of his effort into providing for his daughter.  Miguel was not able to study for a degree in accountancy as he wanted to because he had to work to help his parents from a very young age.  In his free time, he enjoys watching movies and he sometimes cooks a delicious 'arroz con cau cau' to share with his family.

With a lot of determination and dedication, Miguel works as an assistant in a bakery.  He is in charge of mixing the dough and baking the bread.  He works approximately 10 hours every day and believes that he is doing well because he puts a lot of effort into his work and treats others in a friendly manner.

Miguel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to improve the sanitation in his home.  He would like to replace the sink and buy materials for a shower.  In this way, Miguel will be able to improve his family's well-being.  He will also continue working hard to achieve his big dream of opening own bakery.

loans.use: to improve sanitation in his home

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
After graduating from Junior high school, Ruth decided to set up her own beauty salon business in Asekie (near Takoradi). With over 8 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more hair cream, hair extensions and a hair dryer to make her work easier. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support the upkeep of her house, whilst also ensuring that her children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more hair cream, hair extensions and a hair dryer to make her work easier.

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for 6 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income through making ledger books and beads. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Yudaya is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van for ease in transportation. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and the rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with 5 children. She received some schooling through the end of Middle School. Currently, Agnes sells palm oil in Yabiw (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 25 years now. Her husband is a security guard. Agnes’ income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

She will use the loan to increase her existing palm oil inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Agnes plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing palm oil inventory.

loans.name: Romalda

texts.en:
Romalda has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

A $1,200 loan has been offered to Romalda to improve her business. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator to keep drinks.

loans.use: to buy, biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and refrigerator to keep drinks.

loans.name: Ann Marrie

texts.en:
Ann Marrie is 30 years old and married. She has two children living in Tuburan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

Ann Marrie's main source of income is her grocery store, retailing dry goods in the local community. She has been in this business for two years, earning 5,000 PHP a month for a living. 

Ann Marrie is very grateful to have joined GDMPC in 2011 for she gain access to financial services. Recently, she requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a 1995 with her own working capital of $2,000.

She is taking a loan of $1,200 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.   

She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married, 46 years-old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.  She has six children. Fe buys and sells fish to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and earns 8,000 a month which only supports their basic needs. 

She joined Kiva partner GDMPC in 2008 in order to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a loan of 13,000.00 PHP in order to repair the existing boat and to purchase a new fishing net. In the future, Fe wants to buy another fishing boat.

loans.use: to  repair the existing boat and purchase a new fishing net.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is applying for a loan of $1200 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 23 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of a market, and she will use the loan to buy stocks to sell in her store, such as laundry detergent, bathing soaps, hand and body lotion, and other items.. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy laundry detergent, bathing soaps, hand and body lotion, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is taking a loan of $1000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a shop that generates income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better after she applied for her first loan. She will use it to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as shirts, t-shirts, and pants for children and adults. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) because it offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, and pants for children and adults.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 62-year-old man living in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He owns and manages his sari sari (convenience) store business, selling goods in the local community. For 14 years, he's been earning 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for a living. 

In 2008, he joined GDMPC and recently requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Antonio plans to use his revenue and part of this loan to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Alfred S.'s Group

texts.en: In the photo are staff of a leading relief NGO in Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 6,000,000 in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. Staff at various government and non-governmental organizations do normally come to SMT to apply for loans. These loans are very useful in helping them meet certain financial constrains that their salaries cannot meet. Then at the end of each month, their finance officer will deduct the amount they owe SMT/Kiva lenders and repays on their behalf. Alfred is the featured leader of this group of two. He is 40 years of age. Alfred is a native of Makeni city. He is married to a school teacher and together, they have one child who is attending primary school. Alfred has been working for this NGO for four years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, sand, cement, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, sand, cement, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga is 47 years old, married, and a father of three children. For the past three years, he has earned a living by operating point-to-point transport services with his three motorbikes in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of KES 15,100. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his third loan of KES. 30,000. He is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorbikes. He will use the profits to pay school fees for his children as well as continue investing back into his business. 

His goal for the future is to expand his business so as to have more motorcycles  enabling his family be financially stable.

loans.use: To service and repair his motorcycles for his business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married mother of four children who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other clothes sellers. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to buy more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Keneth is single man of twenty six years, he supports his mother and young sister. He is a dairy farmer and also sells second hand clothes. Keneth has been in this business for six years now and gets monthly income of fourteen thousand shillings.

This will be Keneth's seventh loan with KADET LTD, and plans to use the entire loan to buy a bail of jackets for sale. In the future, Keneth plans to buy more cows for his dairy farming business.

loans.use: To buy a bail of jackets.

loans.name: Virna

texts.es: Virna tiene 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, vive en una casa alquilada a lado de su esposo y su hijo.Virna tiene una pequeña empresa dedicada al alquiler de maquinarias y venta de materiales de construcción. Se inició en esta actividad junto a su esposo pero ella se queda a cargo de la empresa y su esposo maneja el trabajo de campo, supervisando el uso de las máquinas y los productos necesarios para la construcción. Eventualmente Virna vende mercadería buscando obtener ingresos extras para mejorar su calidad de vida. Al principio no contaban con el capital ni con las herramientas necesarias para abrir su empresa pero despues de mucho esfuerzo logro obtener el capital necesario para ponerlo a flote y ahora con las ganancias que obtiene espera seguir creciendo para ampliar y mejorar la infraestructura de su local.Para Virna este es el primer crédito con Kiva, y agradece el apoyo económico recibido por lo que se  compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de S/.3000 soles comprará arena , fierro , ladrillos, entre otros materiales para una construcción que realizará en la carretera.
texts.en:
31-year old Virna is a hardworking, responsible woman who lives in a rented house with her husband and son. She has a small business renting out equipment and selling construction materials. She began the business with her husband but now she is in charge while he works on site, supervising the use of the machinery and the products needed for construction. 

Currently Virna sells merchandise as she is seeking to earn extra income to improve their quality of life. At the beginning they didn’t have enough capital nor the tools necessary to open their business but after a lot of hard work, she managed to obtain the money she needed to get it going, and now with the income she hopes to continue growing the business by expanding and improving the premises.

This is Virma’s first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial assistance. She promises to make the repayments punctually. With the S/. 3,000 soles she is seeking, she will buy construction supplies such as sand, metal, and bricks for a building she will erect on the highway.

loans.use: buy construction supplies such as sand, metal, and bricks

loans.name: Salua

texts.en: Salua is a 24-year-old married woman from Lod. She is a trained bookkeeper but, given her love of children and dedication to early childhood education, she decided to open a daycare center. There is much demand for daycare in her city and, working with her mother, she has opened a popular and respected childcare center. Due to the high demand, Salua is expanding her center to take on more children. She needed this loan to pay for renovations and buy additional mattresses for nap time, bedding, and age-appropriate educational and play toys. Salua wants to help to meet the demand for good child care for working mothers in her city. She is working to ensure that the renovations are completed before the sign-up for the fall begins. This will allow additional children to be cared for in her center.

loans.use: to pay for renovations and buy additional mattresses for nap time, bedding and age-appropriate educational and play toys to expand her daycare center.

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en: Nyame is a small-scale farmer and seller of coconuts in Domenase (near Cape Coast). He has had some formal education and is a junior high school graduate. He is married and has five children. His wife is a trader. Nyame has been working as a farmer for close to 15 years. His income is used to help his wife pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. He plans on using his loan to expand his business, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand, and he plans to use the profits to ensure that all his children receive an education.

loans.use: to expand his coconut business, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Because of difficult circumstances, Faustina did not have access to formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Faustina sells frozen chicken in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. She is married to a mechanic, and they have three children together. Faustina uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Faustina will use the loan to buy more chicken, which will help her to  improve her overall sales. Faustina wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Because of difficult circumstances, Mary did not have access to formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Mary sells saucepans in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. She is married to a farmer, and they have seven children together. Mary uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Mary will use the loan to buy more saucepans, which will help her to improve her overall sales. Mary wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Charlotte is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Charlotte is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Charlotte wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Charlotte plans to reinvest future profits in her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.

loans.name: Chattar

texts.en:
Originally from India, Chattar found his calling as an educator and entrepreneur after moving to El Paso to obtain his master of business administration degree from the University of Texas - El Paso. He started teaching math at a local middle school and discovered his calling. Eventually he opened a tutoring business that rapidly grew by word of mouth.

“I enjoy teaching,” Chattar said. “And the students I had learned a lot with my background and my patience and my teaching style.”

Chattar started teaching at a high school and saw that there was a strong need for one-on-one tutoring in math. So he started tutoring his high school students. Eventually, he used his business training background to start a tutoring business. Originally he called the business MathMobile, because math was his specialty. 

“But thereafter it just grew,” Chattar said. “The parents we had started referring us to other clientele and we just grew. And now we have 25 tutors and we just run the business and make sure we hire the right type of people to work as tutors.”

Chattar changed the name of the business to Texas Mobile Tutorials to better reflect the broad range of subjects the company tutors: math, English/reading, social studies, biology, chemistry, physics, history, test preparation, computer programs, and other topics.

Recently, Texas Mobile Tutorials became an approved provider under the Texas Education Agency’s Supplemental Educational Services program, enabling Chattar’s company to serve low-income students in schools at risk of failing to meet state education standards. 

The contract might seem like a boon for Chattar’s tutorial business. But Chattar said he has to pay his tutors and buy the books and other material up front. He is guaranteed payment by the state, but weeks after services have already been delivered. 

So Chattar applied for a working capital loan with Accion Texas Inc. after learning about the nonprofit organization through the Small Business Administration in El Paso. Using his $5,450 loan to buy materials and to pay tutors immediately after rendering services, Chattar said he was able to pick up 10 students from the state program. 

Chattar said he hopes to serve more students through the program as he builds his capital, pays off his loan, and eventually obtains revolving credit for his business.
 
“We would have had to let go of those students if we didn’t get the Accion Texas loan,” Chattar said.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay tutors.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
This is Janeth, 46, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Noe and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Janeth operates a buy and sell business. She sells various snacks and other foods. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy snacks and other products.

Janeth dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for snacks and other products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has four children. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags. She is happy that TRM offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Davaasuren, 23 years old, lives with his wife in their own house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been running a mobile-phone sales business for four consecutive years, and usually get their goods from Koreans or wholesalers. The income from the mobile-phone sales is not sustaining the family's expenses, and recently, he decided to begin rendering taxi service to the local people. 

He is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase an electric car. Electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities because they produce no harmful pollution from the tailpipe from the on-board source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead and various oxides of nitrogen. Purchasing this electric car will help him to generate more income from the taxi service as well as contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. 

She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $500. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits

loans.name: Jenus

texts.en:
Jenus is a 57-year-old married man who has only one child. He lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City, where he buys and sells home products to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years, having an income of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

Recently, he joined GDMPC and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory products. In the future, Jenus dreams to double his income just to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio tiene 29 años y un hijo que tiene la edad de 3 años,  El Sr. Sergio se dedica  a la  reparación de autos, el es mecánico hace ya varios años, tiene su taller  ubicado en la Zona Virgen de Lujan   donde ofrece sus servicios,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Sergio va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de maquinaria para su taller como compresora,  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  actividad, El Sr. Sergio va utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  herramientas para seguir equipando su taller, El Sr. Sergio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es su única actividad.
texts.en: Sergio is 29 years old and has a 3-year-old son.  His business is repairing cars.  He has been working as a mechanic for a number of years and has an auto repair shop in Virgen de Lujan district where he offers his services.  This loan is Sergio's first from the institution.  He will use it to buy machinery for his workshop such as a compressor.  This will allow him to provide his customers with a better service and increase his profits.  His reason for requesting this loan is so that he can continue improving in his business.  Sergio will use the profits he makes to continue buying tools so that he can continue equipping his auto repair shop.  Sergio is a very hard-working person who feels happy to be receiving this opportunity as this is his only business.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his workshop (a compressor)

loans.name: Zaratou

texts.fr: Jeune femme célibataire et sans enfant, Zaratou afin de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens, a entamé l'année dernière le commerce de produits de détails. elle dresse son étalage au marché. Elle veut agrandir son étalage de marchandises, pour cette raison, elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour agrandir son commerce. Elle espère se marier plus tard tout en assurant les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en: A young unmarried woman without children, Zaratou started a retail business last year in order to support herself from day to day. She sets up her display at the market. She wants to expand her display of merchandise. This is why she is requesting from WAGES a second loan to expand her business. She hopes to get married later while  making sure that her primary family's needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase retail products

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a man of forty five years, married to Lucy and a father of three children. He keeps pigs and also runs a retail shop in Kangemi. Samuel has been in this business for sixteen years now and gets monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Samuel's fourth loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use the entire loan to buy 20 piglets to rear and sell later at a profit. In the future, he wants to own more pigs and also educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase twenty piglets.

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en:
Fenny is a woman of sixty two years. She is married to Charles and a mother of three children. She sells materials for making clothes and also African lesos, she has been in this business for seven years and gets monthly income of twenty-five thousand shillings.

This will be Fenny's second loan from KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy new fabric materials for making clothes. In future she wants to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials for dress making.

loans.name: Bawa

texts.en: Bawa is married and has seven children. He has received schooling through the basic level to the middle school level. Bawa is a petty trader who deals in bags of ginger, cola, and yam tubers in Hohoe, as he has done for three years. He travels to the northern part of Ghana to buy his items at cheaper prices and then resells them in the southern part. His wife is a food vendor. Bawa uses his income for all the financial needs of his household and other members of the extended family . Bawa will use the loan to buy bags of ginger, cola, and yam tubers. Bawa intends to reinvest the new profits from his expanded business to enhance his capital.

loans.use: to buy bags of ginger, cola, and yam tubers for his business as a trader.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity owns a provisions shop in Wegbe, Hohoe. Charity received education to the middle school level. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. Charity has been selling provisions for four years. She helps her husband with some basic financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy bags of sugar, rice, margarine, sachets of milo and milk powder. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, rice, margarine, sachets of milo and milk powder to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is married and has seven children. She has never been to school. Stella is food vendor who cooks and sells a variety of dishes at Wegbe, Hohoe, as she has done for the past 11 years. Her main dishes are fufu and banku. Banku/akple is fermented corn/cassava dough mixed in proportion and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste. It is served with soup, stew, or a pepper sauce with fish. Fufu (also known as foofoo or foufou) is a paste made from starchy root vegetables put into a mortar and beaten smooth with a pestle. The malleable dough is served and eaten with a light tomato soup, groundnut soup, palm oil fruit soup, or another soup. Her husband is a farmer. Stella uses her income to give support to her husband in providing for the family. Stella will use the loan to buy bags of corn dough, bags of cassava, plantains, palm fruit, tomatoes, cartons of chicken and meat, and also to get extra hands to help with the cooking. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella intended to save and reinvest so she can improve her profit margins.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava and corn dough, bags of cassava, plantains, palm fruit, tomatoes, cartons of chicken and meat, and also to get extra hands to help with the cooking.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a 2010 with her own working capital of $ 200. 

Flavia is taking a loan of $1,200 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. 

She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy, slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Creselene

texts.en:
Creselene is married and has four children. She is 41 years old and resides at Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. 

Creselene owns and manages a piggery, raising piglets for sale to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years, earning 5,000 PHP monthly.

In 2009, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Recently, Creselene requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase piglets to raise.

She wants to make an improvement of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice, frozen foods, soft drinks, laundry soaps, canned goods, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Anapaula

texts.en:
Anapaula is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. 

She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $100. Anapaula is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Badamtsetseg is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She has graduated as an agrarian and had been working at a private company for years until 2007. She started her own business of organic vegetable growing and selling with her husband in 2007. Her children also help their family business. She is a hardworking, optimistic and well-experienced woman. 

She grows her vegetables from March to October in her greenhouses, and she already built close relationships with her clients, who are retailers in the local market.
